intro: Cyphostemma currorii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in savannas and woodlands. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
